Reviews.Title: “The best Boston has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Chandler2004
Reviews.Content: The Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro is a wonderful hotel in the historic Beacon Hill neighbourhood of Boston. It is very well located, making it easy to walk to the Boston Common, Newbury Street, and downtown. Other parts of the city can be reached by taxi, which are not overly expensive compared to some other destinations. Beacon Hill itself is enchanting, with shops, cafes, and beautiful architecture. Our room was on a street corner several floors up, giving us a great view of the intersection near the hotel and providing plenty of light into the room. The room itself was relatively small but very comfortable, with a great bed and modern bathroom facilities. Our room was at one extremity of the hotel, making Wifi unreliable but there is a quiet lounge area on the second floor in the hotel where the Wifi can be accessed without problem. One of the best parts of our stay was the bistro on the main floor of the restaurant. It is decorated in a simple but classic style that fits very well into Beacon Hill's feel. The food was excellent, and the bar is a great place to relax after a day of walking around the city. The breakfasts were incredible. They were included with the room but you are able to choose anything from the bistro's breakfast menu. This is no continental breakfast - during our stay we had everything from the standard eggs and hash-browns (with toasted warm sourdough bread) to pancakes and yogourt with granola and fresh fruit. The hotel also has a roof-top patio with chairs and tables. A great place to sit and people watch, and the site of our engagement! Parking is a little tricky since the hotel is located in a dense, historic neighbourhood. Parking at the nearby Boston Common was cheap enough, and since you can get around on foot or taxi it is good place to leave your car during your stay. We strongly recommend the Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro and look forward to our next stay - for us, the hotel itself is worth the visit to Boston.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Montour Falls, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and amazing Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ekelly_12
Reviews.Content: Great location a block from Boston Common and Parking at Boston Common. Room was clean and cozy- felt like a guest room at a friend's house more than a hotel. Breakfast is included in the room price and it is out of sight (and I'm a total food snob). 18% gratuity added to room charge for breakfast at the bistro but WOW! so tasty. And the service was great- felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NellDD
Reviews.Content: BHB is in a fantastic spot (Charles St in Beacon Hill is perfect for strolling and shopping) just on the corner of Boston Common near downtown and public transportation. Our room was simple but nicely decorated and comfortable. And the best part is delicious breakfast at the Bistro, included in the room rate - anything you want from the menu, from french toast to salmon omelette!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Hip”
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful - just steps to the Boston Commons and Gardens. Friendly staff in a hip boutique hotel. Parking in the Commons Garage - just park at the far end and it's a short walk to the hotel. Free breakfast too! Able to find a great deal on "jetsetters"

Reviews.Title: “Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro - The Best of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna H
Reviews.Content: The Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro brings out the best Boston has to offer. The best location -Charles Street is truly lovely- and the central location is ideal for sight seeing. My accomodations at Beacon Hill were perfect. I felt at home rather than in some sterile run-of-the-mill hotel. All the amenities, from the furniture to the bathroom to entertainment system are up to date. I'm so happy to have found this gem of a hotel. I'll be back with out a doubt, and to anyone who plans to visit, dont miss sunday brunch- its to die for!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel on an earlier trip to Boston this year. I enjoyed Beacon Hill so much (and Charles street in particular) that I decided to give it a try, and I am truly happy I did so! I stayed in the smallest room, and though it s indeed small, it is by no means claustrophobic (there were 2 windows), you could perfectly move around the double bed, and it was cleverly designed enough to include a tiny closet (with ironing board and all) and a desk. The bathroom was sizable enough to what you would find in bigger hotel rooms. All in all, size was adequate for a single person or a couple without much luggage. Everything was spotless clean and the bed was very comfortable. And for Boston cold weather, the heater (room and bathroom) worked perfectly, and you instantly got hot water (I wish I had that at home). Location is of course perfect, one of the quaintest streets in one of Boston's prettiest (and wealthiest) neighborhoods. The street is lined with small restaurants and shops, and is walking distance to Boston's main attractions and shopping. Last but not least, the hotel restaurant serves delicious food, as attested by the locals who fill the place from breakfast to dinner. The staff is friendly, attentive and ever helpful, which only adds to the feeling that you are staying at a good friend's place in Boston rather than in a hotel. If this is the experience and service you are looking for, you will definitely enjoy your stay here. I am craving to go back, and hope the weather will be (at least a bit!) nicer than last weekend's odd storm.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe M
Reviews.Content: Everything was impeccable: the cleanliness of the rooms, the location of the hotel, and the wonderful views. The food and the staff were immensely courteous and made our stay that much more enjoyable. I used to live in Boston and while nothing compares with a home, the BHHB lends itself to be a home away from home. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My go-to accommodation spot when Iâ€™m in town!”
Reviews.Author: Regina C
Reviews.Content: I just recently completed my second stay at Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro and it will not be my last! I often visit Boston as I lived there during my college days. Since graduating, I no longer live in the city so I thoroughly enjoy my visits to Boston and try to go as much as my work allows me. After trying some average hotels scattered throughout areas like Back Bay and the South End, I decided to try out BHHB. My search ended here. This place was the best! Their cozy and quaint rooms make you feel like your in the comfort of your own home. But probably their strongest attribute had to be the attentiveness of the staff. While I am familiar with Boston to an extent, they were very willing to help me with any additional questions and references to good places to dine out. One night when I wasnâ€™t in the mood to go out, due to the infamous Boston weather, I tried their Bistro for the first time. And the food was delicious!!! I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place with true Bostonian charm in the most convenient of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early September 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although there were a couple of minor problems. We arrived in the evening after a long flight and went straight to bed. When we tried to go to breakfast the next morning, we could not open our door as the lock had jammed. We called reception and somebody came and let us out. After breakfast, we could not get back into the room either, so we had to call for help again. In the end we were given a different key and while we were out that day they called a locksmith to fix the lock. It was still sticky but at least we could open the door OK. We received a personal apology from the hotel owner and the staff were all very apologetic, so we felt they handled the problem reasonably well. The other problem is that our room was immediately above the restaurant on the corner of the street, so in the evening there was quite a lot of noise from the restaurant (until closing time) and from the street, although there was much less noise overnight. Using ear plugs we had no trouble sleeping, and a combination of jetlag and eagerness to explore Boston meant we were up early anyway. The room itself was clean, fairly spacious and simply but comfortably furnished, with a decent bathroom and reasonably large closet where we could stash our suitcases. No bug problems (contrary to reports from other hotels in Boston), thankfully. Breakfast in the bistro was great, with a good menu, excellent quality food and friendly service, and we found the staff generally to be friendly, efficient and helpful e.g. when taking our luggage to the room on arrival. We also ate in the restaurant one evening, which was a very pleasant experience. The location is great, on the edge of Beacon Hill and about 3 minutes' walk from the Public Gardens, which provided a very pleasant 10 minute walk to the Arlington MBTA Green line station, so it was very easy to get around. As others have indicated, this is a small hotel (or "restaurant with rooms") so you need to have realistic expectations, and it is quite expensive even by Boston standards. But we very much enjoyed our visit and would be happy to stay here again next time we are in Boston - so long as we remember to bring our ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Bug bites”
Reviews.Author: Corinne J
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location was perfect. Withing walking distance of the Freedom Trail and Boston Common. However, the toilet did not work, the lock did not work, and I left with dozens of some sort of bug bites. I reported the broken toilet immediately and nothing was done about it during my stay. The lock was already broken when I got there. And I only received a short apology for the bites. Terribly noisy street.

Reviews.Title: “Beacon Hill superior service at great rates.”
Reviews.Author: sengasarah
Reviews.Content: Location location, location! What more do you need to know? From our hotel we were able to walk to a number of excellent restaurants including the one in the lobby of our hotel and walk to all tourist attractions.The rooms are smaller, but think New York. The rooms were well-appointed and fresh. All the amenities were there as well as lovely views of the area from the rooftop balcony. The staff were marvelous especially the front desk people...they couldn't do enough for us. We forgot our guide book and right away came the offer to borrow one of theirs for the days we were there. The bar was a welcome little oasis after a long, hot day of sightseeing. The wait staff were there if you had any questions about the food and always had smiles no matter how busy the restaurant that was filled with locals. Breakfast which was included with the room was a delightand a fabulous way to start the day. We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, convenient, hospitable and a little..burnished around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTraveler45
Reviews.Content: Homey, hospitable and charming in an urban manner, Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro is an accessible alternative to Boston's heavy-hitter hotels across the Common. Yes, the rooms are small and the street traffic can get noisy (amphibious duck tours, Boston? Really?), but anyone reading these reviews should already be aware of those limitations and understand the nature of the hotel: It's a small inn, whose first-floor restaurant takes up the property's footprint, with four floors of undersized (by conventional standards) rooms upstairs, with the added bonus of a third-floor terrace. I had a corner room with a bit more square footage than others, but none of the other rooms I saw seemed uncomfortably tight, just efficiently compact, at least for one person. The wainscoting and trim showed a little wear; it's obviously been a few years since the last refresh, and the bathroom tile and bathtub caulk seams were a bit worn and discolored. None of this really bothered me, although other reviewers who think that condition isn't worthy of a $300+ room have a point. (If I weren't traveling on business, I might have a slightly lesser opinion.) Much of my overall impression was influenced the convenience and quality of the restaurant and bar downstairs, particularly the breakfast (minus some absentminded service). Really excellent food, and there are many other options in the neighborhood, including an Upper Crust across the street. In all, not a perfect hotel, but a very hospitable inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth stay here and we will come again!”
Reviews.Author: TwoWheelsTed
Reviews.Content: We visit Boston at least once a year and have stayed at the Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro four times. And we plan to keep coming back! This small, boutique hotel is perfectly situated on the main street - Charles Street - of Beacon Hill. It is superbly situated within the city of Boston, close to all its attractions. The staff at the "Bistro", as it is known to the locals, are great. Nothing is too much trouble. The hotel has a lovely restaurant and a small bar area. The rooms are not large, but pleasantly appointed and very comfortable. There is free wifi, a lovely terrace overlooking Charles Street, and breakfast in the restaurant is included in the price of the accommodation - a rare find in this city. One small suggestion - add a shower curtain liner in the bathroom to avoid the curtain getting soaking wet!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBS50_10
Reviews.Content: WE just about managed two nights in tiny room with our unpacked cases. No room to move around and place to unpack! Great location in amazing part of Boston. Walk from the door to nice places to eat etc. Great staff. Relaxed and upmarket feel. Breakfast good but vast portions too much. orange juice not offered and coffee only fair. Overpriced but you pay for location. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Rates are greedy for room sizes.”
Reviews.Author: dwh23
Reviews.Content: Perhaps if they knocked through two rooms to make one on each level you would have a normal sized room and the Lilliputian offering here. Fat people, those with more than carry on luggage or substandard agility can forget it. The location is great, granted. The breakfast excellent: granola and French toast world class. This is really what would be called in the UK a "restaurant with rooms" the designation "hotel" falling foul of the trades descriptions act. Staff were all fine. I agree with the consensus here which is visit bistrot and beacon hill but stay in a more orthodox hotel as Boston is small enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtb55
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable. Great location, friendly staff and fantastic free breakfast and wireless. It was a little noisy on the street side, but I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: rupacked
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for a romantic escape. Right on Charles St. with it's old brick homes and gas light street lamps. The decorations on the homes and store fronts and watching a group of carolers on bikes added to the Christmas spirit. Lots of cute shops and great dining near by; and central and walking distance to most of Boston. Service was by front desk manager was top notch, rooms were modern but cozy (think Restoration Hardware) and a lovely breakfast was included. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with Great Location and Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NateMcc
Reviews.Content: I love small, cozy, European-chic hotels like this one with tasty restraunts on the ground floor. This place has a great location, and the rooms are small but comfortable. Gourmet breakfast with table service in the cozy restraunt was included. The price of $200+ per night was on the high end of what I thought was appropriate. If you can snag a room for less than $200 with breakfast included, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Quaint...A True Neighborhood Gem!”
Reviews.Author: jenn245
Reviews.Content: If you want a true neighborhood hotel this is the place to stay. Quaint doesn't begin to describe what a truly charming location this is. From the restaurant (which is one of the best in Boston) to the small neighborhood bar next to a roaring fire, I can't think of a better place to stay in Boston during the Fall. The rooms are intimate and cozy and the staff was great during our stay! If youâ€™re looking for the ultra modern large hotel chain experience this is not the location for you. But if you want to be submerged into Boston culture and be in the heart of the city..this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Periquita
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this inn is the location if you can stand the noise. The rooms are very small, the carpet was dirty, the bathroom grubby and tiny and the closet was a joke. Not even a child could find space to hang some clothes. The noise was terrible from the street, we had a corner room and the garbage truck wakes you up at 1.45 and 4.30 every morning even on the weekend. Its a one way street and the trucks, ambulance and cars are a nightmare. We did not sleep for 4 nights. The price was outrageous and there were no decent ammenities to be had. The Park Plaze, the Fairmont, the Omni are all cheaper and better. Think twice about staying here. The restaurant was very good so stay for dinner but sleep somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “comfy, friendly hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lafou
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night prior to a conference. The staff is personable and professional. The food was very good. My room was small, but I expected that and it was fine. The neighborhood is historical and quaint. The hotel is close to the Boston Common. There is a Starbucks and a CVS nearby, but the stores are predominantly boutiques and non-chain cafes, etc. I gave 4 "dots" for sleep quality because the garbage trucks show up on Charles Street in the dead of night, but I am a light sleeper anyway. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good food, and quaint set up”
Reviews.Author: barneyrubbleHalifax
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week while on course at MIT, hotel is very conviently located in a great location/neighbourhood. Rooms are small, but nice- no bar fridge. Breakfast is include with the room rate and is very good. Bar and bistro have a great decor and were busy all week- seemed quite popular with locals and tourists alike. Common lounge and patio available to guests. Carpet in halls and common areas a little worn/grundgy and some other little maintenance items appear in need of attention, but nothing off-putting on balance. Many great restaurants, pubs and shops in the neighbourhood. In general a great spot for my purposes- and recommend to others who are interested in a small inn like setting.

Reviews.Title: “True Boston”
Reviews.Author: Roofbeam
Reviews.Content: Staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The Common is a very short walk away, and Charles Street itself is particularly interesting. It's an old street in an historic neighborhood where you'll find practical stores for neccessities as well as boutiques and Starbucks. You can park over at the underground lot in the Common after dropping your bags at the hotel--it's on a one way street. The walk from there is short and really pleasant. Breakfast and dinner were served at the long dining room adjacent to the entrance. (Entrance to hotel is also entrance to restaurant.) There is a small bar and a rooftop patio with tables and chairs....a nice place to end the day with a drink from downstairs. This hotel can't be compared to the Westins, Hyatts etc. The neighborhood is fun to explore and practical as well for running, walking, or stopping for coffee. We stayed here as it was close to Mass. General. The rooms are on the small side and there is some street noise. But they are well appointed. Food is very good!! Room guide has a long section on history of neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCouple763
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had a great 4 day stay in this Boston boutique 12 room hotel. The hotel was close to the river for walking/running, close to the trains for getting around to other parts of Boston and close to some great shopping/restaurants on Newbury Street. Don't need a car and it's 15 minutes to the airport. The wine tasting dinner on Monday was very well done with lots of explanations re the wine/food, all for $55 per person. Breakfast was included. The rooms are small and noisy since they're on the street. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room and a pair of earplugs solved the noise issue. For leisure travellers, it's simply location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best staff I've experienced anywhere”
Reviews.Author: SaxSymbol73
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a co-worker, the Beacon Hill was a great place to stay for work. I had meetings at MIT which is only one T station away, as well as the Hynes Convention Center (a 20 minute walk through the Commons and the Back Bay neighborhood). The Beacon Hill neighborhood was like a small, quiet village surrounded by the urban jungle. I used the neighborhood pharmacy and post office, as well as the many shops. All were first-rate, friendly, and genuinely a pleasure to be around. My room was an upper-level corner, with windows on two sides. Not much of a view, but the neighboring brick buildings are charming. The rooftop terrace is easily accessible as well, offering a nice view of the street life below. As for decor, it could use some updating. The carpet was a bit tatty and could use an appointment with a Rug Doctor--this was true on the stairs as well. The duvet was a sand color with African wildlife print--not what I would expect in Boston, but it was fine. The other fixtures were simple, spare, and well-chosen. The restaurant is quite good--contemporary French/American bistro fare. The prices are in-line with what I would expect, and there's a heavy focus on locally produced seafood. Waitstaff was wonderful and the bar mixes a nice G&T. While everything might add up to a perfectly adequate lodging, the staff is really what makes this place shine. Every single person was wonderful--it was like having a concierge at my fingertips. From setting up my reservations online, to my daily interactions with them, the staff of the Beacon Hill is second to none. When I return to Boston, I most definitely will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Charming in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: bostoncouple0121
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were lucky enough to find this jewel in Boston. Not only does this charming hotel have an award-winning bistro, but the staff and rooms refelct the entire reason one should stay in Beacon Hill. If you want a 300 room hotel with a convention center...this is not the place to stay.....if you want the type of hotel with the best food, the best people and European charm....stay here! Peter & Cecilia the hotel owners make sure all your needs are met and they are so fun! When traveling to Boston this is the most unique place to stay in the city...just my two cents!

Reviews.Title: “Good points and Bad points”
Reviews.Author: totallyali
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty area and you cannot really beat the location but there were two significant downsides. Firstly - the room was tiny - really very very small. Secondly - the noise from the street was a huge problem and we couldn't sleep. Even with the windows closed, the noise was unbearable. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “noon meal”
Reviews.Author: jamesrhode
Reviews.Content: ambiance on hot day was very pleasant although meal was meager/ skimpy and expensive. Crab in sandwich was meager, 'wellington ham and emmentaler cheese " in croque monsieur was a very thin slice of each and very thick bread -with far too many french fries. Meals for 4 of us were not up to standard expected from a Charles Street bistro.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beacon Hill”
Reviews.Author: Snonzo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a very short trip to Boston which was an add-on part of a trip to a wedding further up state in Massachusetts. I didn't know where to start when booking a hotel in Boston as all the usual websites were giving me big corporate hotels but I wanted something a bit more boutiquey. I couldn't have done better than the Beacon Hill Hotel & Bistro. For a start, Beacon Hill is without doubt the most beautiful place to stay in Boston. It has a lovely old-world charm and walking along the cobbled stones amongst the beautiful houses and niche shops, with the gas lamps alit, really makes you feel relaxed and like you're on holiday! Have a walk round the corner to Louisburg Square - the houses are fantastic, apparently this is where John Kerry lives. Back to the hotel... what can i say it's very pretty, staff are incredibly attentive. Agree that the rooms are small, although similarly to others we were out exploring most of the time, but I would think if you're here for more than a couple days that you would need more wardrobe space than is provided. However the room is well equipped with all you need despite the size. On arrival our TV was not working properly, but the staff soon had someone in to look at it while we went out and it was fixed on our return. We only ate breakfast in the Bistro, which was complimentary with our stay and it was very good - i had the pancakes, with extra bacon & my husband had the waffles and we shared some fruit - it was all beautifully presented and very tasty - a good set up to our day's exploring! The following morning we had a very early start to the airport and the staff had prepared us some bagels and cream cheese to take with us! As for Boston, we found it to be a fairly small city - we walked everywhere! Shopping is limited so I wouldnt' recommend it for a shopping trip, but if you like history it's a definite! We did the duck tour which was fun, lots of walking and were going to do the MIT tour but it was closed as it was Veteran's Day. As for eating - if you like shellfish you will be in heaven! We tried the Union Oyster House - the oldest restaurant in Boston and my husband was in heaven over the lobster. My prawns were also gorgeous! On our second evening we went for a fine dining experience at Antonys Pier 4 on the harbourside. This restaurant has old school charm and there is a whole wall of photos of famous people who have eaten here - Liz Taylor, The Kennedy's etc! The seafood here was fabulous - you can see the live lobsters and they are HUGE! We both felt thoroughly stuffed when we left and it was super value - $120 including tax and 20% service, which included king prawns for starter (for both of us), whole lobster for him and Sole stuffed with lobster for me. Jacket potoates, salads, breads etc and drinks (although no alcoholic drinks). Overall I would say The Beacon HIll HOtel & Bistro is the perfect base for exploring Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but don't order the duck!”
Reviews.Author: jth
Reviews.Content: A wonderful boutique hotel in a super area in Boston. Rooms are a bit small, and slightly noisy at times (from the street), but it is a fantastic place to stay for location and service. It has an excellent restaurant attached, which provides an extensive breakfast menu (included in room charge). Evening menu is great, seems to be well subscribed to by local residents. But don't order the duck - it's a bit anaemic, leading to a rather bland dining experience - though other meals, chicken/steak/fish are much better( based on one meal experience only!) Would definitely stay here again. (Also has free internet access........!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ADKMM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location, but the service at breakfest is very very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blind-Willie
Reviews.Content: Beacon Hill Hotel is in a great location in one of Bostons best neighborhoods. We walked every where we went without any trouble. The Hotel is small but delivers top notch service. Rooms are a little small, but are comfortable, besides with such a great city we spent very little time in the room. The rates at first seemed high, but Boston Hotels are very pricey and it turned out to be the cheapest rate of the Hotels we considered. Breakfast comes with your stay and it was 5 star made to order in the Bistro. Hint, do not bring a car to Boston you do not need one, there's no where to park, and if you do not know the city, driving here is not for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our way to Martha's Vineyard. We've been to Boston before so didn't feel the need to stay longer (had a fabulous meal at Bricco's in North End!). We stayed in one of the Queen rooms. The room wasn't that big but made good use of space (ironing board folds out from cupboard, LCD TV on wall) and most importantly was clean, although the carpet was beginning to show signs of age. The bathroom was spotless and well equipped (a real plus for my wife!). What we really loved was the character of the room. We've stayed at hotels twice the price and they are just modern and sterile. The downstairs bar was small and inviting with good range of wines, beers and spirits considering it's size. All the staff were helpful, courteous, efficient, and friendly (unfortunately often a rarity these days). Nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed our stay so much we are cutting our Vineyard trip by 1 day to return for a last night in Boston before returning to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: karynd
Reviews.Content: We loved the location on Beacon Hill which is right in the middle of everything. The hotel is small and we got to know all the staff within the few days we were there. Benson (the manager) was very knowledgeable about the city and helped get us great restaurant reservations. The rooms are not big but we didn't care since we were there to walk around the city. The sitting room on the second floor and the third floor terrace gave us the extra space we needed to relax. The bar was great with many locals and Chelsea (the bartender) was fun to talk to. We would definitely stay here if we come back to Boston

HotelInfo.Name: Beacon Hill Hotel and Bistro
